questionListItems.title: What services does the doctor provide during the home visit?

answer.body:
A Home Medical doctor will provide regular visits to the care recipient and help to manage long-term stable medical conditions, review and/or prescribe medication and perform minor medical procedures.


Depending on the care recipient's needs, the doctor will be supported by a team of professionals, comprising nurses, therapists and social workers to ensure that the care recipient receives holistic care at home.

Please click here for more information on the Home Medical service.

The cost of the Home Personal Care (HPC), Home Therapy and Home Nursing service will vary depending on your subsidy level after Household Means-Testing.


Please click here for more information on Home Medical service.

questionListItems.title: Do you provide wound cleaning service?

answer.body:
The Agency for Integrated Care (AIC) can help you to apply for Home Nursing services if your loved one is homebound and the caregiver requires assistance on nursing care at home. Apart from monitoring blood pressure and sugar levels, the home nurse also provides care for wounds, change of feeding tubes, as well as educate and train caregivers in caring for your loved ones.


The services include:

  • Nursing Care

  • Care Coordination

  • Medication Management

  • Caregiver Training


You will be required to approach your loved ones' doctor at the hospital/ polyclinic/ private clinic where they are on follow up, to assist with the application for the home nursing services.


Please click here for more information on Home Nursing service.

questionListItems.title: Do you provide rehab service at home?

answer.body:
If your loved one has difficulties leaving home to receive therapy services at a community rehabilitation centre, Home Therapy services may be considered as an option on the recommendation of your loved one's doctor.


Please click here for more information on the Home Therapy service.

questionListItems.title: What types of rehab services are provided?

answer.body:
The Home Therapy services provided include:

  • Occupational Therapy: Assessing and treating people who need to learn, recover or maintain daily living and work skills

  • Physiotherapy: Assessing and treating problems with movement because of disability, trauma or illness, such as learning how to walk again after a stroke

  • Speech Therapy: Assessing and treating those with problems swallowing and speaking or who have language or communication problems

Please click here for more information on the Home Therapy service.

questionListItems.title: How do I apply for Home Therapy service?

answer.body:
You may approach your loved ones' doctor at the hospital/ polyclinic/ private clinic where they are currently receiving treatment at, to assist with the application for the Home Therapy service.


Please click here for more information on the Home Therapy service.

questionListItems.title: Can I find out more about Day Care service?

answer.body:
Day Care provides a full day programme for seniors who are suitable for centre-based care setting, and require supervision while their caregivers are at work.


The service aims to maintain and/or improve the general, physical and social well-being of seniors through therapy. The centre also doubles as a place for seniors to socialise and take part in recreational activities.


Some day care centres also cater to specific needs:

1.Dementia Day Care provides full day custodial care in a centre-based setting for seniors with dementia. Meaningful recreational activities (e.g. therapeutic, social and recreational) are used to engage seniors with dementia.

2.Day Hospice Care provides a safe and supportive environment for care recipients. Daily activities and therapeutic programmes are organised to enhance quality of life.


3.Respite Care: Caregivers can also tap on Senior Care Centres for short-term care options, such as when they need to take short breaks on an ad hoc basis during the day. This is also suitable if caregivers need additional assistance when the Migrant domestic worker is not available.

Care staff at the centre will provide assitance with your loved one's daily care activities such as eating or going to the toilet. Meals are provided for your loved one, and your loved one can take part in social activities such as games and karaoke sessions. Respite care is available on both weekdays and weekends.

Click here for more information on government subsidies.


Please click here for more information on Day Care service.

questionListItems.title: How can I apply for Day Care?

answer.body:
To apply for Day Care services, you may approach your loved ones' doctor at the hospital/ polyclinic/ private clinic where they are currently receiving treatment at, to assist with the application. Alternatively, you may also approach any AIC Link to apply for the service.


Please click here for more information on Day Care service.

questionListItems.title: How can I apply for Day Care subsidies?

answer.body:
The cost of the Day Care service will vary depending on your subsidy level. This is assessed based on the Per Capita Monthly Household Income Requirement for subsidies for Non-Residential Services under Household Means-Testing. If you have difficulty paying for the service, please speak to your service provider or the Medical Social Worker in the hospital or polyclinic.


Please click here to find out more about means testing subsidies.


Please click here for more information on Day Care service.

questionListItems.title: Can I send my elderly parent for Day Rehab?

answer.body:
Therapy is important for an elderly with heart disease, or who had a stroke, fracture or other condition that affected his ability to do everyday things like walking around or going to the bathroom. It can help him regain his abilities and make a full recovery.


Please click here for more information on the Day Rehabilitation service.

questionListItems.title: What kind of rehab service is provided?

answer.body:
Day Rehabilitation centres may offer services including:

  • Physiotherapy - Assessing and treating problems with movement because of disability, trauma or illness, such as learning how to walk again after a stroke

  • Occupational Therapy - Assessing and treating people who need to learn, recover or maintain daily living and work skills

  • Speech Therapy - Assessing and treating people with problems swallowing and speaking or who have language or communication problems.


Please click here for more information on the Day Rehabilitation service.

questionListItems.title: How can I apply for Day Rehab service?

answer.body:
To apply for Day Rehabilitation service, you may approach your loved ones' doctor at the hospital/ polyclinic/ private clinic where they are currently receiving treatment at, to assist with the application.


The cost of the Day Rehabilitation service will vary depending on your subsidy level. This is assessed based on the Per Capita Monthly Household Income Requirement for subsidies for Non-Residential Services under Household Means-Testing. If you have difficulty paying for the service, please speak to your service provider or the Medical Social Worker in the hospital or polyclinic.


Please click here for more information on the Day Rehabilitation service.

questionListItems.title: My father/mother has dementia. Can I send him/her for day care service?

answer.body:
Dementia Day Care Centres provide activities to engage individuals to stimulate their cognitive functions or optimise their functioning in the community. Some centres provide rehabilitation and skills training. Such also offer an alternative care arrangement to provide relief for caregivers in the day, and provide training for caregivers to help them better care for their loved ones.


Please click here for more information on the Dementia Day Care service.

questionListItems.title: What are the services provided under Dementia Day Care?

answer.body:
Some of the services provided include:

  • Nursing, occupational therapy, physiotherapy and social activities

  • Training for caregivers with knowledge and skills to cope

Please click here for more information on the Dementia Day Care service.

questionListItems.title: How can apply for Dementia Day Care?

answer.body:
To apply for Dementia Day Care service, you may approach your loved ones' doctor at the hospital/ polyclinic/ private clinic where they are currently receiving treatment at, to assist with the application for the aforementioned services.


Please click here for more information on the Dementia Day Care service.
